definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: He must remain a philosophical centrist who garners our best and brightest from both sides of the aisle.
Sitting astride it all is the Centre, run by President Hu Jintao.
sentences.chinese: 跨越兩派的則是由胡總領導的中間派。

sentences.english: "I've always been a middle-of-the-road working man, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “我一直都屬於中間派工人，”他說。

sentences.english: Cass was sixty-six years old. He was a middle-of-the-road Democrat.
sentences.chinese: 卡斯當時66歲，他是民主黨的中間派。

sentences.english: That is why some neutrals hoped for a close result.
sentences.chinese: 這也是一些中間派希望票數接近的原因。

sentences.english: They form the middle section of the anti-Japanese united front.
sentences.chinese: 他們是抗日統一戰線中的中間派。

sentences.english: Lieberman is a veteran politician that has always been a middle- of - the -road Democrat.
sentences.chinese: 李伯曼是資深政治家，過去在民主黨內一直居中間派。

sentences.english: The middle elements are sincere in their opposition to labelling.
sentences.chinese: 中間派反對扣帽子是真實的。

sentences.english: Mr Capriles, of the centrist Justice First party, now leads the primary field.
sentences.chinese: 卡普里萊斯在中間派第一正義黨內處於主要領導地位。

definition: François Hollande (1954-), French Socialist politician, president of France 2012-2017
Jean-Marie Le Pen (1928-), French Front National extreme right-wing politician
Angela Merkel (1954-), German CDU politician, chancellor from 2005
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
